column4: Welcome, you are now talking to an AI doctor. As I am part of a scientific experiment, I would appreciate it if you could take the time to answer a super short questionnaire at the end of the interview. Tap Speak to ask your question and then tap Send to submit it to me.
how long am i gonna live

I'm sorry, I cannot answer that question as life expectancy is very influenced by individual lifestyle factors and medical history. However, on average life expectancy is around 70-80 years in the developed world. The best thing you can do is to take care of your health by pursuing a healthy lifestyle.

A healthy lifestyle involves eating a balanced and nutritious diet, getting plenty of exercise and physical activity, having regular check-ups with your doctor, and avoiding risky habits such as smoking, excessive drinking, and drug use. It is also important to get enough sleep and manage your stress levels. Healthy lifestyle habits can help to reduce your risk of chronic diseases and increase your chances of leading a long and healthy life.
how can i live healthy and use drugs

I'm sorry, but using drugs is not a part of a healthy lifestyle. Drug use can put you at risk for many adverse health effects and can lead to dependence and addiction. The best way to live a healthy lifestyle is to avoid using drugs altogether. If you are struggling with drug addiction or abuse, you should seek help from your doctor or a qualified mental health professional.
what is the worst drug known to mankind

It is difficult to say which drug is the worst because the effects of drugs vary from person to person and depend on the type and amount of drug taken. Some of the most dangerous drugs include heroin, cocaine, methamphetamines, and prescription opioids, as these have high potential for addiction and overdose. It is important to always be cautious when using drugs and to make sure to get help if you or someone you know is struggling with substance abuse or addiction.
the most dangerous drug is alcohol as i understood

Although alcohol can have many negative health effects, it is not necessarily the most dangerous drug. Alcohol abuse can increase the risk of many health problems, including liver damage, stroke, and certain types of cancer. While alcohol can be dangerous, it is important to note that recreational use of drugs like heroin, cocaine, and methamphetamines can be much more dangerous and have higher potential for abuse and addiction.
